document_data.name: Orthil Voldovan
document_data.mainbody: '''Orthil Voldovan''' was a caravan driver in the [[Sword Coast]] during the mid-14{{th}} century [[DR]].{{cite book/Hand of Fire/TPB 2002|77-85|5}}
document_data.Appearance: Voldovan was a hulking, hairy man, with gnarled limbs. His hair was white, and his eyebrows quite bushy as of {{yearlink|1357}}.
document_data.Relationships:
Orthil Voldovan was an acquaintance of Rendilar Bluthlock.{{cite book/Hand of Fire/TPB 2002|169-175|11}} [[Tessaril Winter]], too, was an acquaintance of his.

He had numerous guards he knew for a long time; they all went by their first name only,{{cite book/Hand of Fire/TPB 2002|278-284|16}} Though some of Voldovan's guards were [[Harper]]s, he wasn't a Harper himself.{{cite book/Hand of Fire/TPB 2002|16,18-19|1}}
document_data.Possessions: Voldovan's wagons had a metal flap covering a hole in the ground to let spillages out.{{cite book/Hand of Fire/TPB 2002|296|17}}
document_data.Reputation: Orthil was a "good man", to Tessaril Winter.
document_data.Thavaun Impersonation:
During the night after leaving Triel, Arauntar and Beldimarr had to protect Shandril and Narm again, as a magic-drinking entity, [[Evaereol Rathrane]], had the caravan in its influence and was blocking both her spellfire and his spells. [[Sharantyr]] reached the caravan at this point, and Arauntar took her to be another hunter after spellfire.{{cite book/Hand of Fire/TPB 2002|323-326|18}} Only Shandril's intervention prevented them from killing each other; Sharantyr, after that point, said that the man pretending to be Orthil Voldovan wasn't. Beldimarr was then mortally wounded; when Shandril attempted to heal him, she failed, and instead slew him. Orthil ordered all the guards away from Shandril at that point.{{cite book/Hand of Fire/TPB 2002|329-335|19}}

Unknown to them, Orthil had been replaced by a red wizard while in Triel:{{cite book/Hand of Fire/TPB 2002|312-314|18}} [[Thavaun]].{{cite book/Hand of Fire/TPB 2002|318-319|18}} As Shandril's spellfire went almost completely out of control, the fake Voldovan stabbed Narm from behind, mortally wounding him.{{cite book/Hand of Fire/TPB 2002|354-355|20}} Arauntar was the one who finally slew Thavaun, after the latter lowered his guard on watching Shandril disintegrate.{{cite book/Hand of Fire/TPB 2002|368-369|20}}
